title: 109_hr5306
content: Extension of National Guard authorities to Mayor of the District of Columbia. Extension of National Guard authorities to Mayor of the District of Columbia. Section 6 and 72 of the Act are amended to replace "President of the United States" with "Mayor of the District of Columbia." Appointment of Commissioned Officers is also modified accordingly. Section 9, 13, 19, and 20 of the Act are amended to replace references to the President with the Mayor of the District of Columbia. This includes changes to the appointment process for Commissioned Officers. Section 20 of the Act is amended to replace references to the President with the Mayor of the District of Columbia. This includes changes to retirement and duty orders. Additionally, the Mayor will now be involved in general courts martial proceedings. SEC. 2. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS TO TITLE 10, UNITED STATES CODE. Amendments are made to various sections of Title 10, United States Code, replacing references to the commanding general of the District of Columbia National Guard with the Mayor of the District of Columbia. Amendments to Title 10, United States Code replace references to the commanding general of the District of Columbia National Guard with the Mayor of the District of Columbia for consent on active duty, relocation, and units. Amendments to Title 10, United States Code now require the Mayor of the District of Columbia to give consent for the relocation of units, replacing the commanding general of the District of Columbia National Guard. SEC. 3. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS TO TITLE 32, UNITED STATES CODE. Amendments to Title 32, United States Code include changes to the maintenance of other troops, drug interdiction activities, additional assistance, and the appointment of the Adjutant General. Amendments to Title 32, United States Code involve replacing references to the commanding general of the District of Columbia National Guard with the Mayor of the District of Columbia in various sections related to National Guard duties and personnel matters. Amendments to Title 32, United States Code involve replacing references to the commanding general of the District of Columbia National Guard with the Mayor of the District of Columbia in various sections related to National Guard duties and personnel matters. This includes changes in subsections (g)(2), (j), and (k), as well as in the issuance of supplies in section 702(a). Amendments to Title 32, United States Code involve replacing references to the commanding general of the District of Columbia National Guard with the Mayor of the District of Columbia in various sections related to National Guard duties and personnel matters. This includes changes in subsections (g)(2), (j), and (k), as well as in the appointment of a Fiscal Officer in section 708(a). Amendment to the District of Columbia Home Rule Act removes reference to the National Guard of the District of Columbia.
